item.title: Head Teaching Assistant in Artificial Intelligence
Head Mounted Displays in Warehouses
item.description: For the best part of my time here in Georgia Tech I have worked with Dr. Thad Starner as a researcher in Head Mounted Displays. Thad is a great mentor; he's a Georgia Tech Professor, the director of the Contextual Computing Group and the Technical Lead on Google Glass.

item.title: Lattice Mesh Generation
item.description: The goal of this project was to generate a custom 3D lattice support structure in between two arbitrary surfaces. These single-mesh lattice structures have a variety of uses in the medical field. They can be 3D printed and inserted into the human body to support a vain or a damaged organ.

item.title: Hackathon 1st place
item.description: Our Card-Cache application won the 1st prize in the Career App challenge in the Hack GT 2017 Hackathon.

item.title: Georgia Tech
item.description: I’m currently pursuing a Master’s Degree in Computer Science. I will be graduating on May 2019.

item.title: Arrival in the USA
item.description: On August 14th, I arrived to the United States, starting my MS degree in Computer Science at Georgia Tech.

item.title: Mandatory Military Service
item.description: I have completed my mandatory military service (9 months) in the Greek Army.

item.title: University of Patras
item.description: I graduated from the University of Patras in 2016, with a B.E. in Electrical & Computer Engineering.

item.title: Augmented Reality 3D Maps
item.description: This mobile application turns paper Contour Maps to 3D Augmented Reality Terrains.

item.title: 3D Tetris
item.description: “3D Tetris” is a 3D, Virtual reality remake of the classic video game Tetris. The goal of the project was to create a smooth, fun and easy to use version of Tetris for the Virtual Reality world.

item.title: Software Engineer Intern
item.description: During the Summers of 2015 and 2016 I interned with Mantis Informatics S.A. as a Software Engineer, developing Augmented Reality applications for Head Mounted Displays.

item.title: Contour Map Triangulation
item.description: ‘Contour Segmentation and Terrain Pathfinding‘, was a university project for the course ‘Computational Geometry’, taken in 2015. The project's goal was to triangulate a contour map and generate its 3D representation. Pathfinding Search Algorithms were then implemented on the generated terrain. It was developed solely on C++, using a vvr’s graphics framework, so no OpenGL.

item.title: CineRaptor
item.description: CineRaptor is a Social Media Platform for movie fans. Users can share, review, discover and archive movies they like, while at the same time, keep in touch with their friends (or cinephiles). CineRaptor is connected with the International Movie Database (IMDb), allowing users to be completely up to date with the latest movie releases. IMDb guarantees that a user can find any movie ever released.

item.title: Ancient Conquest
item.description: Ancient Conquest is a game modification for SEGA’s Medieval II Total War, one of the most celebrated strategy games of all time. The original game is set in the Middle Ages, and the player’s goal, is to take the reins of a Medieval Kingdom and bring glory to its people.
